item.title: Conclusion of Piketty's Capital in the 21st Century
item.description: The Central Contradiction of Capitalism The Central Contradiction of Capitalism is: r > g A market economy based on private property, if left to itself, contains powerful forces of convergence, associated in particular with the diffusion of knowledge and skills. It also contains powerful forces of divergence, which are potentially threatening to= democratic societies the values of social justice on which they are based. The principal destabilizing force is rate of return on private capital r being significantly higher for long periods than the rate of growth of income and output g.
